content.question: ​A model rocket is launched from a site on level ground. One second after the rocket is launched, it is at a height of <math alttext="20.1"><mn>20.1</mn></math> meters above the ground. One additional second later, it is at a height of <math alttext="30.4"><mn>30.4</mn></math> meters above the ground. A quadratic regression using the heights of the rocket at times <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 2"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> seconds is calculated to model the rocket’s height above the ground, in meters, at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> seconds. At what time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> seconds, does the model predict that the rocket will land back on the ground?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
